tag_professor: Tough Grader (5)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (4)  LECTURE HEAVY (4)  Clear grading criteria (3)  Participation matters (2)  Caring (2)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)  Amazing lectures (1)
comments: Very structured class. As long as you go to lecture and pay attention you will be fine.

tag_professor: Tough Grader (5)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (4)  LECTURE HEAVY (4)  Clear grading criteria (3)  Participation matters (2)  Caring (2)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)  Amazing lectures (1)
stu_tags: SKIP CLASS? YOU WON\'T PASS.  LECTURE HEAVY  LOTS OF HOMEWORK
comments: Class is very lecture heavy full of graphs and very specific definitions and examples that are given. Class is mandatory as she takes attendance off an iClicker and will have pop quiz questions on it every class for credit. Lecture is dry, homework off Sapling online is easy to get 80%+, 3 tests are very hard and graded heavily, two papers.

tag_professor: Tough Grader (5)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (4)  LECTURE HEAVY (4)  Clear grading criteria (3)  Participation matters (2)  Caring (2)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)  Amazing lectures (1)
comments: The class consists of online hw due every Sunday night. You\'ll learn basically everything you need to know from her lectures which you need to take notes to refer back to for hw. You don\'t really need the book but can just use it as a reference sometimes. She is a tough grader and there\'s not much room to mess up but she wants you to succeed.

tag_professor: Tough Grader (5)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (4)  LECTURE HEAVY (4)  Clear grading criteria (3)  Participation matters (2)  Caring (2)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)  Amazing lectures (1)
comments: She is a wonderful professor. Her lectures are clear and uses lots of examples so that students understand the material. She wants students to ask questions and engage. Make sure to read the textbook if you don\'t understand, it helps a lot. Definitely recommend taking her for this class.

tag_professor: Tough Grader (5)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (4)  LECTURE HEAVY (4)  Clear grading criteria (3)  Participation matters (2)  Caring (2)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)  Amazing lectures (1)
stu_tags: LECTURE HEAVY  TOUGH GRADER  SKIP CLASS? YOU WON\'T PASS.
comments: Dr. Frey isn\'t the best nor the worst. The class is entirely lecture so be prepared to take notes the entire time. There are three test, clicker questions, and online homework that make up your grade. Definitely do the practice problems before the test and actually study for the test, it will help a ton. Studying is key to doing well in the class.

tag_professor: Tough Grader (5)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (4)  LECTURE HEAVY (4)  Clear grading criteria (3)  Participation matters (2)  Caring (2)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)  Amazing lectures (1)
stu_tags: CARING  CLEAR GRADING CRITERIA  AMAZING LECTURES
comments: Everything on the exam is covered by her lecture notes. Make sure to attend class to fill in the blanks in her Powerpoint notes. Very organized, straight-foward lectures. Weekly online hw isn\'t hard and helps my grade. iClicker questions are based on participation rather than correct answers. Nice, encouraging teacher! 2 exams + Final.

tag_professor: Tough Grader (5)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (4)  LECTURE HEAVY (4)  Clear grading criteria (3)  Participation matters (2)  Caring (2)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)  Amazing lectures (1)
stu_tags: SKIP CLASS? YOU WON\'T PASS.  TOUGH GRADER
comments: Frey knows what she\'s talking about, but her lectures are dry and long. She grades hard, but if you\'re interested in the subject you can pull through. Take notes on her power points and you\'ll have all the info you need for exams.

tag_professor: Tough Grader (5)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (4)  LECTURE HEAVY (4)  Clear grading criteria (3)  Participation matters (2)  Caring (2)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)  Amazing lectures (1)
comments: Dr. Frey is fair and has much to offer to a student. I took her for 464- Nat. Resource Economics and although the class was tough, a good grade is achievable if you work for it. She is knowledgeable and responds to questions well. Go to class, take notes, do the study guide. Drops an assignment and a quiz. Textbook not necessary

tag_professor: Tough Grader (5)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (4)  LECTURE HEAVY (4)  Clear grading criteria (3)  Participation matters (2)  Caring (2)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)  Amazing lectures (1)
stu_tags: SKIP CLASS? YOU WON\'T PASS.  CLEAR GRADING CRITERIA  TOUGH GRADER
comments: She\'s challenging but she\'s fair. Probably one of the only professors in the department whose lectures & tests are clear. She does her best to engage in a large lecture hall and connect dry material to real-life examples. Assigns easy homework (Norton SmartWork) that helps you study and daily iClicker points. Good lecturer for difficult content.

tag_professor: Tough Grader (5)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (4)  LECTURE HEAVY (4)  Clear grading criteria (3)  Participation matters (2)  Caring (2)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)  Amazing lectures (1)
comments: Tests are very in depth, she doesn\'t prepare you for them enough. She is not helpful during office hours, nor does she seem to really care if you pass. She is not that organized during lectures. She should have practice worksheets or something to help students get more involved and understand better. You\'re graded on exams, hw, & clicker questions.

tag_professor: Tough Grader (5)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (4)  LECTURE HEAVY (4)  Clear grading criteria (3)  Participation matters (2)  Caring (2)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)  Amazing lectures (1)
comments: Although my grade in this class turned out to be an A, do not be fooled. This class will challenge you. Dr. Frey does not speak clearly most of the time, you will likely go to her office for further clarification. Rarely is the textbook utilized, so rent it. Overall, I would not recommend her, even though the material is interesting.

tag_professor: Tough Grader (5)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (4)  LECTURE HEAVY (4)  Clear grading criteria (3)  Participation matters (2)  Caring (2)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)  Amazing lectures (1)
comments: She\'s a nice professor and you can tell she knows her stuff. Glad that she let us use the older edition textbook and knows that students have a limited budget (no need to buy Scantrons or Bluebooks either). Class had only 1 midterm, poster with option to do it with a group, 5 problem sets and 6 quizzes but she drops one of each

tag_professor: Tough Grader (5)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (4)  LECTURE HEAVY (4)  Clear grading criteria (3)  Participation matters (2)  Caring (2)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)  Amazing lectures (1)
comments: Not sure why all the bad reviews. She is a good professor who goes through all the material in class. Can be a bit tricky at times, but she goes through all you need to know in class. Not too hard

tag_professor: Tough Grader (5)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (4)  LECTURE HEAVY (4)  Clear grading criteria (3)  Participation matters (2)  Caring (2)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)  Amazing lectures (1)
comments: Frey was alright. Didn\'t like how she did the grading for online Aplia. She also didn\'t give us much time to complete them..Made a mistake on her powerpoints almost every class and would shrug it off and laugh. Definitely didn\'t find it funny. Tests were extremely in depth. Expect multiple choice and short answer.

tag_professor: Tough Grader (5)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (4)  LECTURE HEAVY (4)  Clear grading criteria (3)  Participation matters (2)  Caring (2)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)  Amazing lectures (1)
comments: Professor states the obvious during lectures and is not very efficient with class time, just reads power point. Does not appear to know the subject that well. Grading is HORRIBLE, class AVG on the midterm was 54% your grading is ridiculous! the exams go into much more detail than her lectures do so reading the book is a must, lectures are boring.

tag_professor: Tough Grader (5)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (4)  LECTURE HEAVY (4)  Clear grading criteria (3)  Participation matters (2)  Caring (2)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)  Amazing lectures (1)
comments: The point distribution on exams is terrible! There isn\'t much room for error when MC questions are worth 2 points and fill in the blank questions are 6 points. You don\'t need to buy a physical copy of the textbook, just use Aplia & read the chapter before class because she tends to contradict herself often which makes things confusing. Study A LOT.

tag_professor: Tough Grader (5)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (4)  LECTURE HEAVY (4)  Clear grading criteria (3)  Participation matters (2)  Caring (2)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)  Amazing lectures (1)
comments: Dr. Frey is a harsh Grader, I\'m barely passing with a C and I put in the work.

tag_professor: Tough Grader (5)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (4)  LECTURE HEAVY (4)  Clear grading criteria (3)  Participation matters (2)  Caring (2)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)  Amazing lectures (1)
comments: Frey is pretty difficult. Her tests are for professional economists rather than students. Do not take!!!!!!

tag_professor: Tough Grader (5)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (4)  LECTURE HEAVY (4)  Clear grading criteria (3)  Participation matters (2)  Caring (2)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)  Amazing lectures (1)
comments: She apparently got in trouble for failing so many people when she started. I assume the older comments reflect that. She is not too bad. Not great either. Her notes are exactly like the book. Just study her notes and you don\'t really need to buy it.

tag_professor: Tough Grader (5)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (4)  LECTURE HEAVY (4)  Clear grading criteria (3)  Participation matters (2)  Caring (2)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)  Amazing lectures (1)
comments: Not the best professor in the world. Her notes are just like the tests but with different numbers. I got a B and I never read or bought the book. Studied straight from her notes.
